Posts.Content: Hi, I used Biafine as soon as my skin started to go red, just make sure you don't apply anything at least 4 hours prior to the treatment.  I also got a couple of yoga bras from Sweatty Betty made from bamboo they were really soft and not too tight. I am extremely fair and never go into the sun and I tolerated RT really well. I only had some reddening and slight peeling towards the end.   It's impossible to say who will have an easy time of the treatment and those that don't. As for fatigue I definitely felt it, the cumalative effects build up.  I had around 35 treatments and started to feel really tired towards the end.  If you are "only" having 15-20 treatments then you may not feel it at all. Good luck and wishing you very few side effects. Julesx

Posts.Title: Mastectomy margins

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, I had a lumpectomy and my surgeon couldn't get clear margins as he had removed the facia and got down to the chest wall. A lot of people on another board were frightening me about the margins but I talked to my medical team and they told me that in 20% of cases it is not possible to get them due to the location of the tumour. My case is different to you as I had lumpectomy followed by radiation around 35 doses which included 6 boosts. I was told if I had a masectomy I would probably need radiation as well. I also went through chemo as a preventative measure as I was quite young at the time of diagnosis (38). Even though our cases are different I just wanted to let you know that not having clear margins is more common than you think. I am one year on from diagnosis and I am NED. Good luck, Jules x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy margins

Posts.Content: Hi, Congratulations on making it through chemo and rads.  Hair thinning could be a side effect of Tamoxifen it is listed as one of the problems we may face. However, you have only been finished from chemo for 3 months and hair does grow at different rates.  Hopefully your follicles are just taking awhile to wake up compared to the areas that are growing. I finished chemo 7 months ago and the hair at the back of my head is around 3.5 to 4" long and the front and sides range from 2.5" to 3 inches.  The side of my head by the temples was very slow to grow and I was concerned I was going to look bald then but it soon appeared. I would say not to stress.  To make hair grow I tried horsetail supplements which were recommended to me but they smelt of tobacco and I wasn't comfortable taking them.  I now take Biotin which people rave about but  I've also read it is not effective.  I guess you can't go wrong with a good diet and plenty of Omega 3. Good luck and wishing you good hair days.  I currently look like Ronald McDonald's sister.  It's ok from the front with a head band but the sides and back are so curly and out of control it's unbelievable.  Someone asked me the other day where I got my perm from sigh........... Jules x
